channel.title: Feudalism on The Condition of the Republic
channel.description: Recent content in Feudalism on The Condition of the Republic

item.title: Notes on Irish Feudalism
item.description: Duffy, Se√°n, Brian Boru and the Battle of Clontarf. Gill Books, 2014. 4 A body of law tracts called the Brehon laws surviving from the 7th - 9th centuries give us a lot of information on medieval Irish society. In early Ireland individuals did not own land in their own right but as part of a kin-group. The group that inherited the land was not the modern family, but a four-generation group, the derbfhine comprising male descendants of a common great-grandfather.
